briefdescription.para: Batch Stride is typically batch_size, but may be a multiple of batch size if there are multiple readers.

detaileddescription.para: If there are multiple instances of the reader, then it may not reset to zero

If there are multiple models with multiple instances of the reader, each model's set of readers may not reset to zero Provide a set of size, strides, and thresholds to handle the last mini batch of a dataset
Sample stride is used when a mini-batch is finely interleaved across a DATA_PARALELL distribution.

briefdescription.para: Stride used by parallel data readers within the model.
Record of the indicies that are not being used for training.
The index at which this data reader starts its epoch.
The index of the current mini-batch that has been loaded.
The index of the current mini-batch that is being processed (train/test/validate)
How many iterations all readers will execute.
How many parallel readers are being used.
What is the rank of the data reader within a given model.
1-D Matrix of which indices were fetched in this mini-batch

added to support data store functionality

detaileddescription.para: ctor

briefdescription.para: set the comm object
returns a (possibly nullptr) to comm

detaileddescription.para: Set base directory for your data. Optional: if given, then get_data_filename will concatenate the value passed to this method with the value passed to set_data_filename, and similarly for get_label_filename
Returns the base directory for your data. If set_file_dir was not called, returns the empty string

Set the filename for your data (images, etc). This may either be a complete filepath, or a subdirectory; see note for set_file_dir(). Also, use this method for cases where the file contains a list of files (e.g, imagenet)
Returns the complete filepath to you data file. See not for set_file_dir()
Set the filename for your data (images, etc). This may either be a complete filepath, or a subdirectory; see note for set_file_dir()
Returns the complete filepath to you data file. See not for set_file_dir(). Note: some pipelines (autoencoders) will not make use of this method.
If set to false, indices (data samples) are not shuffled default (in ctor) is true.
Returns true if data samples are shuffled.
Set shuffled indices; primary use is for testing and reproducibility
Returns the shuffled indices; primary use is for testing.

Read the first 'n' samples. If nonzero, this over-rides set_absolute_sample_count, set_use_percent. The intent is to use this for testing. A problem with set_absolute_sample_count and set_use_percent is that the entire data set is read in, then a subset is selected
Sets the absolute number of data samples that will be used for training or testing.

Set the percentage of the data set to use for training and validation or testing.
s
The percentage used, in the range [0, 1].

Sets the percentage of the dataset to be used for validation.
s
The percentage used, in the range [0, 1].
Set an idenifier for the dataset. The role should be one of "train", "test", or "validate".
Get the role for this dataset.

Load the dataset. Each data reader implementation should implement this to initialize its internal data structures, determine the number of samples and their dimensionality (if needed), and set up and shuffle samples.

Prepare to start processing an epoch of data. If shuffle is true, then shuffle the indices of the data set If the base offset is not specified set it to 0 If the stride is not specified set it to batch size

inbodydescription.para: The amount of space needed will vary based on input layer type, but the batch size is the maximum space necessary

detaileddescription.para: Return this data_reader's type

briefdescription.para: Fetch this mini-batch's samples into X.

inbodydescription.para: Allow each thread to perform any preprocessing necessary on the data source prior to fetching data
Allow each thread to perform any postprocessing necessary on the data source prior to fetching data

briefdescription.para: Fetch this mini-batch's labels into Y.
Fetch this mini-batch's responses into Y.

memberdef.name: save_image

detaileddescription.para: Save pixels to an image. The implementing data reader is responsible for handling format detection, conversion, etc.
During the network's update phase, the data reader will advanced the current position pointer. If the pointer wraps around, then reshuffle the data indicies.

inbodydescription.para: Maintain the current height of the matrix

detaileddescription.para: Returns the current adjustment to the mini-batch size based on if the world master (model 0) has any extra samples Note that any rank in model 0 does not need to add in this offset since the model will already be aware of the extra samples

detaileddescription.para: This call changes the functionality of fetch_data(); when set, indices are added to m_my_minibatch_indices, but fetch_datum() is not called. This method is added to support data store functionality.

detaileddescription.para: Return the absolute number of data samples that will be used for training or testing.
Returns the percent of the dataset to be used for training or testing. If training, this is the total for training and validation. Throws if set_use_percent was not called.
Return the percent of the dataset to be used for validation.
Returns the number of global indices. For train and validation, this is the sum of their numbers

Called before fetch_datum/label/response to allow initialization.
Called after fetch_datum/label/response to allow initialization.

briefdescription.para: Shuffle indices.

detaileddescription.para: A data reader manages reading in data in a particular format. This abstract base class manages common functionality. In particular, child classes should implement load and the appropriate subset of fetch_datum, fetch_label, and fetch_response.
